description: Auto-generate or manually define sidebars
---

# Sidebar Configuration

Configure the sidebar navigation for your documentation.

## Auto-Generated Sidebars (Recommended)

Sidebars are configured in `sidebars.ts`. The simplest approach is to auto-generate the sidebar from your file structure:

```typescript
import type { SidebarsConfig } from '@docusaurus/plugin-content-docs'

const sidebars: SidebarsConfig = {
  guidesSidebar: [{ type: 'autogenerated', dirName: '.' }]
}

export default sidebars
```

### How It Works

- Docusaurus automatically creates the sidebar based on your `docs/` directory structure
- Folders become collapsible categories
- Files become sidebar items
- Use `sidebar_position` in frontmatter to control order
- Use `sidebar_label` in frontmatter to customize labels

### Example File Structure

```
docs/
├── contributing/
│   ├── index.mdx               (sidebar_position: 1)
│   └── getting-started.mdx     (sidebar_position: 2)
├── getting-started/
│   ├── installation.md         (sidebar_position: 1)
│   └── configuration.md        (sidebar_position: 2)
└── guides/
    └── advanced.md
```

## Manual Sidebar Configuration

For complete control over sidebar structure, you can define it manually:

```typescript
const sidebars: SidebarsConfig = {
  guidesSidebar: [
    'contributing/index',  // Document ID
    {
      type: 'category',
      label: 'Getting Started',
      items: ['installation', 'configuration']
    },
    { type: 'link', label: 'GitHub', href: 'https://...' }
  ]
}
```

### Common Item Types

- `doc` - Link to a document
- `category` - Collapsible group with nested items
- `link` - External or internal link
- `autogenerated` - Auto-generate from directory

For detailed configuration options, see the [Docusaurus Sidebar Documentation](https://docusaurus.io/docs/sidebar).
